function.name: label
function.comment:
Declares a label for 'goto' command.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: skipNext
function.param: Number of commands to skip. Default 1.
function.comment:
Skip one or several next commands, as given in parameter amount.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: goto
function.param: Name of a label to go to
function.comment:
Go to the position at the given label.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: gotoIf
function.param: Condition expression. If it evaluates to true (compared non-strictly), then the control goes to a statement at the given label.
Name of a label to go to
function.comment:
Go to the position at the given label, if condExpr evaluates to true (compared non-strictly).
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: if
function.param: Condition expression. It determines whether to run the positive branch or negative branch (if present).
function.comment:
Conditional statement and a start of its positive branch. It evaluates given condExpr. If it evaluates to true (compared non-strictly), then the control flow continues until the matching endIf or matching else (or elseIf). Otherwise, any elseIf steps are considered. If none of them has condition that is true and if there is a matching else statement, then the control continues from there (the negative branch). Otherwise it continues from the matching endIf.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: ifPromise
function.param: A Javascript expression that evaluates to a Promise. Its result (once resolved) determines whether to run the positive branch or negative branch (if present).
function.comment:
Similar to if, but condExpr should evaluate to a Promise object. The resolved value of the promise determines the control flow.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: elseIf
function.param: Condition expression. It determines whether to run the positive branch or negative branch (if present).
function.comment:
Conditional sub-statement and a start of its positive branch. It can be used only after an if (or after any previous elseIf step(s)). It must be located before endIf of the matching if. If the matching if had a false condition (and if any and all elseIf steps had false condition(s)), then this elseIf evaluates its condExpr. If that is true (compared non-strictly), then the control flow continues until the matching endIf or matching else (or until next elseIf). Otherwise, if there is a matching else statement, then the control continues from there (the negative branch). Otherwise it continues from the matching endIf.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: elseIfPromise
function.param: A Javascript expression that evaluates to a Promise. Its result (once resolved) determines whether to run the positive branch or negative branch (if present).
function.comment:
Similar to elseIf, but condExpr should evaluate to a Promise object. The resolved value of the promise determines the control flow.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: else
function.comment:
Negative branch of a matching if statement; optional. If the matching if evaluated its condition as false (compared non-strictly), then it passes the control here.
If the condition evaluated as true (compared non-strictly), then the positive branch was processed (i.e. any statements between the matching if and this else). On reaching this else, the control skips this negative branch and continues from the matching endIf.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: elsePromise
function.comment:
Similar to else, but for use with ifPromise.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: endIf
function.comment:
End of conditional statement. After evaluating the condition of the matching if and after running its positive (if) branch or its negative branch (else, if present), the control switches here. endIf ends the whole if (and optional else) structure. It ends the negative branch (else, if present), otherwise it ends the positive branch (if).
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: endIfPromise
function.comment:
Similar to endIf, but for use with ifPromise.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: while
function.param: Condition expression.
function.comment:
Conditional loop statement. As far as it evaluates to true (compared non-strictly), it keeps running all statements up to the matching endWhile.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: whilePromise
function.param: A Javascript expression that evaluates to a Promise. Its result (once resolved) determines whether to start/continue with the loop, or whether to skip/finish it.
function.comment:
Conditional Promise-based loop statement. It evaluates condExpr, which should return a Promise object. As far as the promise resolves to true (compared non-strictly), it keeps running all statements up to the matching endWhilePromise.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: endWhile
function.comment:
End of the matching while.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: endWhilePromise
function.comment:
End of the matching whilePromise.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: repeat
function.comment:
Conditional loop statement with a condition at the end. It repeats all statements up to the matching until.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: until
function.param: Negative condition expression.
function.comment:
End of the matching repeat. It keeps repeating all statements since the matching repeat until condition negativeCondExpr evaluates to true (compared non-strictly).
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: repeatPromise
function.comment:
Conditional Promise-based loop statement with a condition at the end. It repeats all statements up to the matching untilPromise.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: untilPromise
function.param: A Javascript expression that evaluates to a Promise. Its result (once resolved) determines whether to stop the loop, or whether to continue it.
function.comment:
End of the matching repeatPromise. It evaluates negativeCondExpr, which should return a Promise object. Once the promise resolves to true (compared non-strictly), the loop stops running all statements since the matching repeatPromise. As far as it resolves to false, the loop continues. However, if the promise fails (rather than resolves), this raises a catcheable error.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: for
function.param: Composite defining loop bounds and repetition condition, C/C++/Java/Javascript/PHP-like, in 3 parts separated by semicolons: initiation; condition; iteration. For example: $i=0; $i<=100; $i++
function.comment:
Loop with initiation, condition for repetition and iteration. First, it evaluates the initiation part of parameter forSpec. Then it evaluates the condition part of forSpec. If true (compared non-strictly), it runs any statement(s) between this for and its matching endFor. On reaching the matching endFor, it evaluates iteration part of forSpec. Then it evaluates the condition part again and if true, it repeats the statements again... When the condition part evaluates to false (compared non-strictly), it passes the control to the matching endFor statement.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: endFor
function.comment:
End of for loop.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: forEach
function.param: Variable name, that will be assigned values from valueExpr.
Comma-separated values or expressions, that will be iterated through. Can be empty.
function.comment:
It iterates through given list of values/expressions, assigning each to a stored variable with name varName. For each value, it then runs statement(s) up to the matching endForeach.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: endForEach
function.comment:
End of the matching forEach.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: foreach
function.comment:
Obsolete. Instead, use forEach.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: endForeach
function.comment:
Obsolete. Instead, use endForEach.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: forIterator
function.param: Variable name, that will be assigned values from valueExpr.
A Javascript expression that evaluates to an iterator object (not iterable, neither GeneratorFunction).
function.comment:
It iterates the given iterator. It stores each iterated value to a stored variable with name varName. For each value, it then runs statement(s) up to the matching endForeach.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: endForIterator
function.comment:
End of the matching forIterator.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: forIterable
function.param: Variable name, that will be assigned values from valueExpr.
A Javascript expression that evaluates to an iterable object (not an iterator, neither GeneratorFunction).
function.comment:
It iterates the given iterable. It stores each iterated value to a stored variable with name varName. For each value, it then runs statement(s) up to the matching endForeach.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: endForIterable
function.comment:
End of the matching forIterable.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: loadVars
function.comment:
Deprecated. Use loadXmlVars instead.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: loadXmlVars
function.param: File path or a file:// URI to an xml file to load. If it's not a file:// URL, then it should be relative to location of the test case (not the test suite). Value sets is loaded from <vars> element(s).
Boolean condition to select a set of values from the XML. Optional; if not present, then the XML must have exactly one set of variables - one element <vars>.
function.comment:
Load a set of variable(s) from an XML. If condition is present, then loadVars keeps reading sets of values from XML, until the condition evaluates to true (compared non-strictly). If it reaches the end of XML and the condition is still false, loadVars fails. Each set of variable(s) is within its <vars> element. See original reference at http://refactoror.wikia.com/wiki/Selblocks_Reference for more.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: loadJsonVars
function.comment:
Similar to loadXmlVars, but this is for JSON. See loadXmlVars.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: forXml
function.param: File path or a file:// URL to an XML file. You can enter path to the file, relative to location of the current test case (not the test suite). (You can use Windows or Unix folder separators \ or /). In order to pass a full absolute path, enter file://...
function.comment:
An XML-based loop. (I think that) on each iteration, it loads a set of variables from the XML (one set of variables per one element <vars>). Then it runs any statement(s) up to the matching endForXml.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: endForXml
function.comment:
End of the matching forXml.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: forJson
function.param: File path or a file:// URL to a JSON file. You can enter path to the file, relative to location of the current test case (not the test suite). (You can use Windows or Unix folder separators \ or /). In order to pass a full absolute path, enter file://...
function.comment:
This doesn't work well and I believe it didn't work well in original SelBlocks either. Developers: see @TODO in selblocks.js. Doc. once fixed: A JSON-based loop. (I think that) on each iteration, it loads a set of variables from the given file which should contain them in JSON notation. Then it runs any statement(s) up to the matching endForXml.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: endForJson
function.comment:
End of the matching forJson.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: continue
function.comment:
Jump back to top of the current (innermost active) loop (either for, foreach, while, forJson or forXml) for next iteration, if any.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: break
function.comment:
Jump back to the bottom of the current (innermost active) loop and exit it.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: call
function.param: Name of the script to call.

Argument(s) passed to the called script, optional. Each argument becomes a stored Selenese variable in that function. Use following two ways:
Comma-separated assignments in form variableName=expression. You can use $upperStoredVariableName to access stored variables in expression.
Alternatively, pass an object passed =<>...<> as per https://selite.github.io/EnhancedSelenese. Each field of that object is passed to the Selenese function. (However, do not use @<>...<> syntax.)
function.comment:
Call a script with the given name. Just like calling a function/method in common programming languages. It
saves any stored variables, and it removes them from the current scope
puts all given arguments to the current scope of stored variables
passes control to the called script
The called script may be in a different test case, as far as it's a part of the same test suite (this is how SelBlocks Global differs from SelBlocks). If the called script finishes correctly - either at its endScript or return (if present) - then
the control is passed back to the caller
any stored variables from the called script are lost
the original stored variables are loaded to the scope
any returned result from the called script is avaliable in stored variable _result
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: function
function.comment:
Start of a script, which is a callable block, like a function/method in common programming languages. It gets invoked via call statement. It can (optionally) receive parameter(s) and it can (optionally) return a value via return. It has a separate scope of stored variables. It contains statement(s) up to the nearest endScript. It can call other scripts via call, but it cannot contain other scripts within itself. It can call itself recursively, either directly or indirectly.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.
function.param: Name of the function.

function.name: script
function.comment: Obsolete. Use function instead.

function.name: endScript
function.comment: Obsolete. Use endFunction instead.

function.name: return
function.param: Value/expression to evaluate and return.
function.comment:
It ends the currently executed function, returning the flow control to the caller and passing given value as stored variable _result.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: endFunction
function.comment:
It ends the currently executed function, returning the flow control to the caller, without setting stored variable _result.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: exitTest
function.comment:
It ends the current test run.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: try
function.param: Label-like name of this try block, used for validation of proper pairing; optional.
function.comment:
It starts a try..catch..finally..endTry block. If there is any exception/error within this block, then any subsequent steps are skipped and it runs the catch part (optional). If there's a finally part, that gets executed whether the try part was successful or not.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: catch
function.param: Error message to catch, optional. If present, it must be a Javascript expression that evaluates to a string or to a regular expression, matching the whole error message or its substring. E.g. a string quoted within '..' or "..." , or a regular expression within /.../.
function.comment:
It starts a catch part of its try..catch..finally..endTry block. If there was a matching exception, then its steps are run (until finally or until its matching endTry). There can be only one or no catch for any try.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: finally
function.comment:
It starts a finally part of its try..catch..finally..endTry block. Steps between finally and its ending endTry are executed, whether there was any error/exception or not (unless the testing stopped for some other reason, e.g. exitTest).
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: endTry
function.param: Label-like name of this try block, used for validation of proper pairing; optional.
function.comment:
End of try..catch..finally..endTry block.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: throw
function.param: A Javascript expression that yields a string or an error. If it's a string literal, enclose it in apostrophes or quotes.
function.comment:
Throw an error.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: promise
function.param: A Javascript expression that evaluates to a Promise.
function.comment:
Similar to getEval, but Promise-based. It evaluates the given script just like getEval does. However, it requires the result of the script to be a Promise object. Then it waits until the promise gets resolved, or until it times out. If the promise times out or it resolves with a failure, this throws an exception.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: storePromiseValue
function.param: A Javascript expression that evaluates to a Promise.
Name of a stored variable to save the result value of the promise, if the promise gets resolved successfully.
function.comment:
Similar to promise. If the promise resolves successfully, this command saves the result to the given stored variable.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.

function.name: breakPoint
function.comment:
Stop execution here as if it were a breakpoint. It allows the user to resume execution via Selenium IDE GUI.
Use for debugging only. Don't use when running all suites with Run All Favorites.
This command is a part of SeLite SelBlocks Global.
